column4: hey folks i installed ubuntu 8 on pentium IV,everthing went fine, but when i tryed to log in i just get a black screen, i could not log in on GUI, then i did this reboot,recovery mode root sudo apt-get remove compiz compiz-core , now i can log into my GUI i just upgraded to 9.04 is my ubuntu fine now or i need more to configure
ok you got it working, but  if you had to install graphics card driver before, well it won't be there now
system > administaration  > hardware drivers
yeah
ok
what card you got?
Intel maybe?  maybe a Intel graphics card to, meaning there woudn't be a driver in there
nividia and ATI drivers tend to be in that thing, and nothing else as far as I know.   ok  fine  try compiz again if you want
hmm
the application itself is  probably  ok,  if  it's running on Windows
Wine is pretty good, but far from perfect,  certain apps just work, others need configuring
How much RAM do you have?  ,because with enough you can run Windows inside Ubuntu in a virtual machine,   not that good for 3D gaming, but  for your app  it will be good
that will do it
well XP and  a few other versions, not sure about Vista
as much as I like virtual machines though
they should really be a last resort when it comes to Windows programs, before doing a psyical boot
if the vm won't cut it
XP,  Windows 7 RC,   etc etc,  should all run in VM on your computer, not sure about Vista
try #winehq  they may have some ideas on how to get your program to work properly in Wine
try #winehq
lspci in the terminal
